langs.quirks: Doc comments use /** ... */
Supports nested block comments with #= ... =#.
No native multi-line comments. Multi-line can be faked with here-docs like `: <<'EOF' ... EOF`.
No native multi-line comments. Multi-line can be faked with here-docs like `: <<'EOF' ... EOF`.
Triple quotes are technically strings, but often used as block comments/docstrings.
Some dialects also accept # (MySQL).
ARM 64-bit assembly (AArch64). Usually single-line comments use '//' in modern assemblers.
ARM 64-bit assembly (AArch64). Usually single-line comments use '//' in modern assemblers.
NASM/TASM use ';'. GAS (AT&T syntax) uses '#'.
Old ARM assembly uses '@' for single-line comments. No standard block comments.
Must be at line start (no inline after data in some parsers).
SGML-style, must not be nested.
SGML-style, must not be nested.
Only block comments are supported. No single-line comment syntax like `//`.
Supports C-style `/* */` multi-line comments. Both `//` and `#` are valid single-line comment starters.
`=begin`/`=end` must start at column 0. Single-line `#` comments can appear anywhere.
One ';' for inline, ';;' or ';;;' for section/doc conventions.
One ';' for inline, ';;' or ';;;' for section/doc conventions.
:: is a hack; REM is the official keyword.
No block comments, only line comments.
%% marks cell boundaries in scripts.
Supports both '#' and '%'.
Single line '*' requires a terminating semicolon.
* must appear at start of line.
Older fixed-format Fortran uses column-specific rules.
Column 7 with '*' denotes a comment line. '*> comment' is free-form.
No block comments.
Double quotes enclose comments.
Some dialects also allow '//' as single-line.
Similar to Prolog but stricter syntax.
No block comments.
Nested block comments are supported.
Supports nested block comments.
Inherited OCaml-style block comments plus C-style single-line.
Block comments can be nested.
Doc comments use '##'.
Multi-line can also be nested with '--[=[ ... ]=]'.
Entire line after % is ignored.
Block comments use the keyword COMMENT followed by a semicolon.
Only single-line comments.
Nested block comments are supported.
Only idiomatic block comments using OBTW/TLDR.
Comments are written as 'IGNORE' statements.
Only space, tab, LF are instructions; all else ignored.
Single-line comments only.
Alias of HyperTalk, single-line only.
Only apostrophe (') is valid for comments. 'REM' does not work in VBScript, unlike VBA/Batch.
VBA uses the same comment syntax as classic Visual Basic (apostrophe or REM). VBA typically lives inside Office documents; exported modules commonly use .bas/.cls/.frm.

HTA (HTML Application) is HTML + embedded scripts. Top-level markup uses <!-- -->. Embedded script blocks can be VBScript (use ' or REM) or JScript/ECMAScript (use // and /* */). This node treats HTA as a mixed-content file (unique node ‚Äî not grouped with HTML, VBScript, or JS).
WSF is XML-based and may embed VBScript ('), JScript (//, /* */), or other engines. Outer XML uses <!-- -->.
